intro: Eriosema puberulum, commonly known as the hairy eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom during the warmer months. Eriosema puberulum is typically found in grassy areas and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
